slides.content:
# CSS Colors ðŸŒˆ

Colors are specified using predefined color names, or RGB, HEX, HSL, RGBA, HSLA values.

## Color Names
140 standard color names are supported.
`color: Tomato;`
`color: DodgerBlue;`
`color: MediumSeaGreen;`

slides.title: In Depth: RGB and HEX
slides.content:
# RGB & HEX ðŸ§®

## RGB (Red, Green, Blue)
Values between 0 and 255.
`rgb(255, 0, 0)` is Red (max red, no green/blue).

## HEX (Hexadecimal)
A 6-digit code `#RRGGBB`.
`#FF0000` is Red.
`#000000` is Black.
`#FFFFFF` is White.

```css
h1 { color: #f2f2f2; }
p { background-color: rgb(255, 99, 71); }
```

slides.title: Transparency (Alpha)
slides.content:
# Transparency (Opacity) ðŸ‘»

## RGBA
The **A** stands for Alpha (opacity). From 0.0 (transparent) to 1.0 (opaque).

`rgba(255, 99, 71, 0.5)` (50% transparent)

## Opacity Property
Sets opacity for the entire element *including* its content!

```css
div {
  opacity: 0.5;
}
```

slides.title: Background Color
Background Image
Background Repeat & Attachment
slides.content:
# Controlling Backgrounds ðŸ”§

## No Repeat
`background-repeat: no-repeat;` (Shows image only once)

## Position
`background-position: center;` (Centers the image)

## Attachment
`background-attachment: fixed;`
The background image stays fixed (does not scroll with the rest of the page).

## Cover
`background-size: cover;`
Resize the background image to cover the entire container (might crop).
